H0.text: The mass of the crumpled paper is much more than that of the flat paper, which has a mass of 5 grams.

H1.text: Slightly more than that of the flat paper is the mass of the crumpled paper, which began as a flat sheet weighing 5 grams.

H2.text: The mass of the crumpled paper is the same as that of the flat paper, which has a mass of 5 grams.

H3.text: Slightly less than that of the flat paper is the mass of the crumpled paper, which was crumpled from a flat piece of paper weighing 5 grams.

A4.text: the law of conservation of mass... states that for any system which is closed to all incoming and outgoing transfers of matter, the mass of the system must remain constant over time

A5.text: Careful experiments were performed in which chemical reactions such as rusting were allowed to take place in sealed glass ampoules; it was found that the chemical reaction did not change the weight of the sealed container and its contents
